    • Method Detail

      • createBitmaskImage

        public static BufferedImage createBitmaskImage(int width,
                               int height)
        Creates a BufferedImage compatible with our default screen device, with BITMASK transparency. This means that each pixel of the image will be either completely opaque (alpha 255) or completely translucent (alpha 0).

      • createOpaqueImage

        public static BufferedImage createOpaqueImage(int width,
                              int height)
        Creates a BufferedImage compatible with our default screen device, with OPAQUE transparency.

      • createTranslucentImage

        public static BufferedImage createTranslucentImage(int width,
                                   int height)
        Creates a BufferedImage compatible with our default screen device, with TRANSLUCENT transparency.

      • loadOpaqueImage

        public static BufferedImage loadOpaqueImage(Path p)
        Load an opaque image from a given Path

      • loadTranslucentImage

        public static BufferedImage loadTranslucentImage(Path p)
        Load a translucent image from a given Path

      • loadBitmaskImage

        public static BufferedImage loadBitmaskImage(Path path)
        Load a bitmask image from a given Path.
        Parameters:
        path - path from which to load the image

      • loadBitmaskImage

        public static BufferedImage loadBitmaskImage(Path path,
                             int transparentColor)
        Load a bitmask image from a given Path, optionally making a specified color transparent.
        Parameters:
        path - path from which to load the image
        transparentColor - the 0x00RRGGBB color to make transparent. If equal to -1, no color transparency filtering will be performed.

      • getScaledImage

        public static BufferedImage getScaledImage(BufferedImage img,
                           int scale)
        Returns a scaled version of a buffered image.
        Parameters:
        img - image to scale
        scale - the factor (> 1) by which to scale the image
        Returns:
        scaled image

      • getSubImage

        public static BufferedImage getSubImage(BufferedImage img,
                        int sx1,
                        int sy1,
                        int sx2,
                        int sy2,
                        int scale)
        Returns a new image generated from a sub-rectangle of the given source image.
        Parameters:
        img - source image
        sx1 - the x coordinate of the first corner of the source rectangle.
        sy1 - the y coordinate of the first corner of the source rectangle.
        sx2 - the x coordinate of the second corner of the source rectangle.
        sy2 - the y coordinate of the second corner of the source rectangle.
        scale - scale factor (>= 1) by which to enlarge the resulting image
        Returns:
        new image

      • repaintImmediately

        public static void repaintImmediately(JComponent component)
